content: leroy s kitty baby bonnet for the furry infant in your life i used worsted weight yarn and a size g hook for leroy s bonnet i used purple and white for the trim please read the part that says attention at the bottom i m sure we all love our furry children and don t want anything to happen to them please keep in mind this is leroy sized he is a big boy only in size though lol he weighs about 15 pounds and is not chunky so if you have a smaller cat you will need to adjust the hook size if i get the time later i will write a pattern adjusted for a smaller furbaby abbreviations double_crochet-double_crochet yo-yarn over decrease double_crochet-yo draw up loop in next stitch yo draw through 2 loops yo draw up loop in next stitch yo and draw through all loops on hook with purple or desired color chain 33 double_crochet in the 4th stitch from hook double_crochet across 31 stitches including the first chain row 2 4 double_crochet in each stitch across chain 3 turn row 5 double_crochet in 1st double_crochet decrease double_crochet 2x chain 3 turn decrease double_crochet in next 2 stitches double_crochet in turning chain fasten_off attach at other end & chain 3 double_crochet in next stitch decrease double_crochet 2x chain 3 turn decrease double_crochet in next 2 stitches double_crochet in last stitch ignore chain 3 fasten_off skip next 6 stitches join in 7th empty stitch & chain 3 double_crochet in next 6 stitches chain 3 turn double_crochet in each stitch fasten_off holding piece flat join in 1st stitch it should look like the image below 1st stitch /ll lllllll ll\ double_crochet in each stitch across ignoring skipped stitches in the row below this will make it bunch up and give it ear holes you should have 13 stitches counting chain 3 as 1st chain 2 turn decrease double_crochet across double_crochet in last stitch chain 1 turn 8 stitches the last row will be one big stitch pull up a loop in each of the 1st 2 stitches * yo & pull up loop in next stitch yo and pull through 2 loops repeat from 8 3x yo and pullup loop in each of next 2 stitches yo & pull through all chain 1 to finish stitch fasten_off weave in all your ends starting at bottom right corner with right side facing you join trim color yarn i used white 2 single crochets in corner stitch single_crochet evenly around brim of bonnet 3 single_crochet in other corner and even across the bottom and 1 more in the starting stitch i used approximately 2 single crochets per end of row 3 stitches in each of the 2 bottom corners and evenly across bottom of bonnet starting again at bottom right corner you should be right there otherwise fasten_off and join in bottom right corner 3 double_crochet in each stitch across brim part to the bottom left corner to make
